details.content: JDS leader HD kumaraswamy met Congress MLAs ahead of crucial floor test. JDS- Congress combine confident of defeating BJP. Congress leader Ramalinga Reddy says all congress MLAs are with them.
Two Congress MLAs Anand Singh and Pratap Gowda Patil haven't reached the assembly for oath-taking. All BJP members are present in the house while some JDS members are yet to come.
Two Congress MLAs Anand Singh and Pratap Gowda Patil haven't reached the assembly for oath-taking. All BJP members are present in the house while some JDS members are yet to come.

CM BS Yeddyurappa & Siddaramaiah take oath as MLAs at Vidhana Soudha. #Karnataka pic.twitter.com/WpqdEuT5OW

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018
After winning assembly elections, B Sriramulu and BS Yeddyurappa have resigned from Lok Sabha, their resignations have been accepted by the Speaker.
Congress issue whip to all its members.
Ahead of floor test, Congress issues whip to all its members.

Visuals of BJP MLA B Sriramulu & CM BS Yeddyurappa inside Vidhana Soudha ahead of #FloorTest which will be held at 4 pm. #Karnataka pic.twitter.com/rUbxCtVqrr

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018
BJP is trying anything and everything to buy our MLAs. But, our MLAs are intact. Two of our MLAs are still not here, whenever they come they will surely support us: Veerapa Moily, Congress

Congress leaders go hunting for missing MLAs after reports that they are at a hotel. @NewIndianXpress #KarnatakaCMRace #Karnatakafloortest

— KIRAN PRAKASH (@MSKiranPrakash) May 19, 2018

He (BJP's BY Vijayendra) called the wife of a Congress MLA & asked her to request to her husband to vote for Yeddyurappa. He said, we'll give your husband a ministry or else we'll give Rs. 15 crore to your husband: VS Ugrappa, Congress. pic.twitter.com/CwzHTy3Ol7

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

details.title: BJP, Congress MLAs missing
details.content: BJP MLA G Somashekhar Reddy is with the two 'missing' Congress MLAs Anand Singh and Pratap Gouda, reports ANI citing sources.

Security tightened outside Goldfinch Hotel in Bengaluru where reportedly the two 'missing' Congress MLAs are holed up #karnatakafloortest pic.twitter.com/sEJFPvwAlS

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018
Karnataka assembly adjourned for lunch, to resume at 3.30 pm.

details.title: Missing MLAs under Reddy custody: Congress
details.content: Congress claims MLAs Anand Singh, Pratap Gouda held captive by Reddy brothers in Goldfinch Hotel, according to TV reports.

One of the 'missing' Congress MLAs Anand Singh seen leaving Bengaluru's Goldfinch hotel #KarnatakaFloorTest pic.twitter.com/qY77RCZfHC

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018
Lot of talks around the house that Yeddyurappa may resign as soon as house reconvenes and head to Raj Bhavan to submit resignation to speaker.
House adjourned till 3.30 pm. 207 MLA's have taken oath till now.
Two missing MLA's both from Congress, fail to turn up till the time the house was adjourned for lunch.
Pratap Gowda Patil has come. He will take oath as an MLA then he will vote for the Congress. He will not betray Congress party: DK Shivakumar, Congress.

I am sure he will resign before the trust vote: DK Shivakumar, Congress on CM BS Yeddyurappa #KarnatakaFloorTest pic.twitter.com/DpvCVKtUCS

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

Bengaluru: Congress MLA Pratap Gowda Patil seen leaving from Goldfinch Hotel for Vidhana Soudha #KarnatakaFloorTest pic.twitter.com/Tc9udBOHTo

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

Bengaluru: Congress MLA Pratap Gowda Patil having lunch at Vidhana Soudha, Congress's DK Suresh and Dinesh Gundu Rao present with him. pic.twitter.com/dZwx9zFhKa

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018
Union Minister Ananth Kumar & CM BS Yeddyurappa are present in the CM chamber in Vidhana Soudha.

#WATCH: Dramatic visuals of the moment when Congress MLA Pratap Gowda Patil who was said to be missing, entered Vidhana Soudha. #KarnatakaFloorTest pic.twitter.com/XINBGZvped

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

#WATCH: The reaction of BJP's Shobha Karandlaje when asked about the #FloorTest, which will be conducted shortly, smiles and says, 'Wait and see. In politics every decision is wonderful & happy.' pic.twitter.com/8P8hgY6OqC

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

I was with my brother in Taj West End. Nobody was in my contact. I don't even know who are they, Anand Singh and Pratap Gowda Patil (Congress MLAs). I did not even go to Goldfinch Hotel: Somashekara Reddy, BJP MLA & brother of Janardan Reddy to ANI pic.twitter.com/1s9IGknvL0

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

Congress leaders Ghulam Nabi Azad, Ashok Gehlot, Mallikarjun Kharge with BJP leaders Ananth Kumar and Shobha Karandlaje in Karnataka's Vidhana Soudha #KarnatakaFloorTest pic.twitter.com/QrHEKzdtH3

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

#WATCH Congress MLA Anand Singh who was said to be missing, sits with Congress's DK Shivakumar in the assembly. #floortest pic.twitter.com/0INIdju2fs

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

Congress MLAs Anand Singh and Pratap Gowda Patil, who were said to be missing, take oath as an MLA in Karnataka's Vidhana Soudha. #FloorTest to be held at 4 pm. pic.twitter.com/JCMmH4XqJk

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

People have blessed us with 104 seats. The mandate wasn't for Congress or JD(S): CM BS Yeddyurappa ahead of #FloorTest pic.twitter.com/XGGrNaZbCJ

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018
I have traveled throughout the state for the last two years and have seen pain on the faces of people. I can't forget the love & affection I received from people: CM BS Yeddyurappa.
People of the state have voted decisively against misgovernance of Congress, but they have formed an opportunistic alliance: Yeddyurappa.

"Farmers of the state must get justice. Now Siddaramaiah wants Kumaraswamy to become CM. He swore that he would not let Kumaraswamy become CM. I will serve farmers till my last breath. I thank the people of the state for voting for the BJP," Yeddyurappa further adds.

If only people would have given us 113 seats instead of 104, we would have made this state a paradise: CM BS Yeddyurappa ahead of #FloorTest pic.twitter.com/3m374UKLBY

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

We will get 28 out of 28 seats in Lok Sabha: CM BS Yeddyurappa ahead of #FloorTest pic.twitter.com/7W5OQb5RN4

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

I will lose nothing if I lose power, my life is for the people: CM BS Yeddyurappa ahead of #FloorTest pic.twitter.com/XuOrmx6LUE

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018
Karnataka CM BS Yeddyurappa resigns ahead of Floor Test.
"I have faced many 'agni parikshas' in my life", Yeddyurappa says in the assembly.

"BJP has faith in democracy. In the upcoming elections in 2019, will work towards winning 28 out of 28 seats for Lok Sabha. In the next 5 years, or earlier, don't know when elections will come, but we will definitely win 150 seats. No question of losing," BSY further says.

BSY: (looking at DK Shivakumar) You didn't have faith in your own MLA's. Even family members were not allowed to speak to them when you had them sequestered. Today, they will be able to talk to their family. Mr. Kumaraswamy, I will continue to fight. I resign from post of CM.

Bengaluru: BJP's BS Yeddyurappa reaches Raj Bhavan after resigning as Chief Minister of Karnataka. pic.twitter.com/CkmQokODy3

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

Bengaluru: Congress' DK Shivkumar, JD(S)'s HD Kumaraswamy & other MLAs at Vidhana Soudha after resignation of BJP's BS Yeddyurappa as Chief Minister of Karnataka. pic.twitter.com/qdGu8zGXWK

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

Right now news has come that BS Yeddyurappa has resigned as Karnataka's CM, are all of you happy? All those who believe in democracy are happy: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu (File Pic) pic.twitter.com/JVFuGK7yJ1

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

We are waiting for invitation from the Governor's House: JD(S)'s HD Kumaraswamy on being asked when he will take oath as Chief Minister #Karnataka pic.twitter.com/Uol7BK46lg

We would like to congratulate the MLAs of Congress, JD(S), independent as well as BSP who resisted all sorts of temptations & arm twisting by Central govt. They stood by the party principles & decision taken by the party leadership: Ghulam Nabi Azad, Congress pic.twitter.com/iy3YmAfIsG

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

Congress workers celebrate in #Dehradun after BJP's BS Yeddyurappa stepped down as Chief Minister of #Karnataka. pic.twitter.com/wAeCX5ZeHo

I am proud that opposition stood together & defeated the BJP and we will continue to do so: Rahul Gandhi after BS Yeddyurappa's resignation as Karnataka CM pic.twitter.com/jo8qciyFoW

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

Did you notice that after the entire exercise in Karnataka Vidhan Sabha, the BJP legislators & speaker chose to leave the house before the national anthem? It shows they can disrespect any institution if in power, both BJP & RSS have disrespected institutions: Rahul Gandhi.

You've seen openly how the PM directly authorized purchasing of MLAs in Karnataka, so the idea that PM spreads in the country that he is fighting corruption, is a blatant lie, he is corruption: Rahul Gandhi.

You've seen openly how the PM directly authorized purchasing of MLAs in Karnataka, so the idea that PM spreads in the country that he is fighting corruption, is a blatant lie, he is corruption: Rahul Gandhi.

This is a big blow for them(BJP) and I think what they had been planning all along for 2019 has failed, they will now have to rethink and alter their strategies: Mayawati on BS Yeddyurappa's resignation as Karnataka CM. #FloorTest pic.twitter.com/NW9AiPq410

JD(S)'s HD Kumaraswamy will meet Governer Vajubhai Vala at 7.30 pm, to stake claim for forming government.

West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu & Telangana CM KC Rao congratulated me. Mayawati ji has also blessed me. I have invited all regional leaders for oath ceremony. I've also invited Sonia Gandhi ji & Rahul Gandhi ji personally: HD Kumaraswamy pic.twitter.com/g07Q1aAhPO

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018
HD Kumaraswamy says Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala has given 15 days time to prove majority.

Congress doesn't agree with any such statement. #Karnataka Governor, murdered democracy, however, any statement made on him personally won't be accepted. Rahul Gandhi & Congress have regard for their worst enemies unlike PM Modi: Randeep Surjewala, Congress on Sanjay Nirupam pic.twitter.com/CJ9mwBz9JN

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018
HD Kumaraswamy addressing media after meeting governor on Saturday evening. (Photo | Nagraja Gadekal)
Swearing-in ceremony of JDS-Congress government will be on May 23 instead of May 21, says JDS leader HD Kumaraswamy.

The Governor has invited HD Kumaraswamy to form the government. He will take the oath as the Chief Minister on Wednesday, May 23 at around 12:30pm: Danish Ali, National Secretary General, JD(S) #Karnataka pic.twitter.com/QJD5sWgHI3

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2018

We are going to take oath on Wednesday as Monday is Rajiv Gandhi's death anniversary & so that is not a proper date: HD Kumaraswamy, Chief Minister-elect #Karnataka pic.twitter.com/07AkxbtdtD
